snippet: Fruitless efforts to seriously curb greenhouse gas pollution suggest a new approach is warranted — making it costly not to join an international consortium committed to fighting climate change.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column argues that quarter-century effort to get large polluting nations to voluntarily lower greenhouse gas emissions by necessary margins has failed; supports idea of international 'climate club,' in which member nations would impose uniform tariff 4 percent on imports from nonmember countries; says such an economic stick is likely to induce universal participation in effort to fight climate change.
lead_paragraph: Fruitless efforts to seriously curb greenhouse gas pollution suggest a new approach is warranted — making it costly not to join an international consortium committed to fighting climate change.

headline.print_headline: Climate Deal Badly Needs a Big Stick
